LAWS OF PROPOSITIONAL LOGIC
                            Disjunction
    De Morgan's laws|$\lnot(p \lor q) \equiv \lnot p \land \lnot q$
    absorption laws |$ p \lor (p \land q) \equiv p$ 
    negation laws   |$p \lor \lnot p \equiv T$
    double negation law|$\lnot\lnot p \equiv p$
    idempotent laws |$p \lor p\equiv p$
    commutative laws|$p \lor q\equiv q \lor p $
    associative laws| $(p \lor q) \lor r \equiv p \lor (q \lor r)$
    distributive laws| $p \lor (q \land r) \equiv (p \lor q)\land(p \lor r)$
    identity laws   | $p \lor F \equiv p$
    domination laws | $p \lor T \equiv T$


                            Conjunction  
    De Morgan's laws|$\lnot(p \land q) \equiv \lnot p \lor \lnot q$
    absorption laws |$ p \land (p \lor q) \equiv p$ 
    negation laws   |$p \land \lnot p \equiv T$
    idempotent laws |$p \land p\equiv p$
    commutative laws|$p \land q\equiv q \land p $
    associative laws| $(p \land q) \land r \equiv p \land (q \land r)$
    distributive laws| $p \land (q \lor r) \equiv (p \land q)\lor(p \land r)$
    identity laws   | $p \land F \equiv p$
    domination laws | $p \land T \equiv T$

    implication law    $p \rightarrow q \equiv \lnot p \lor q$

    converse, contrapositive and inverse
    let p and q be propositions and A the conditional statement p -> q
    the proposition q -> p is the converse of A
    the proposition$\lnot q$->$\lnot p$is the contrapositive of A
    the proposition$\lnot p$->$\lnot q$is the inverse of A
